pullRequest.title: Refactor deposit processing
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR Description


 Implements Eth1DepositsManager so that, on top of the efficient Deposit event querying using block ranges, we handle scenarios where the eth1block that triggers genesis has no deposits but only an appropriate timestamp.


 Refactor's DepositRequestManager into DepositProcessingController and DepositFetcher, to make Pow codebase more modular and testable.


 Implements unit testing suites for DepositProcessingController and DepositFetcher.


An acceptance test to test the general flow of Eth1DepositsManager and GenesisHandler will be done in a follow-up PR.

nodes.bodyText: Suggest renaming to notifyMinGenesisTimeBlockReached to make it clear this is firing an event not dealing with things "post" (aka after) the genesis time block reached.
If it's equal then min genesis time is also in the existing block chain list (because it is the head block).
nit: LOG is now unused.
Appears to be unused, but may be needed for some of the error handling that's currently missing.
I'd be tempted to split this into a MinimumGenesisTimeBlockFinder class.

We've got a weird mix of volatile and non-volatile fields in this class.  I think we'll wind up with calls from two sources - Eth1Manager and the latest block subscription.  Probably the best thing it to make all fields non-volatile but all entry point methods (including ones passed as handlers to the subscription subscribe method) should be synchronised.
Not 100% sure of that though.

I'd be tempted to just make this a DepositContractAccessor.create method.  It's simple enough that it probably doesn't need a separate factory class.  Then the DepositContractAccessor constructor can be made private (or package protected if it's needed by tests).
